meanings.definition: Cause great and continual trouble to.
meanings.sent1: The noisy neighbors bedeviled the peaceful community with their loud parties.
meanings.sent2: The constant rain bedeviled the farmers, making it difficult to harvest their crops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel bedeviled the gardener by stealing all the birdseed.
meanings.sent4: The relentless traffic bedeviled the city streets, causing endless delays.
meanings.sent5: The persistent headache bedeviled her, making it hard to focus on her work.

meanings.sent1: The school bully bedeviled the younger students on the playground every day.
meanings.sent2: The ghostly figure bedeviled the old mansion, scaring away potential buyers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten bedeviled the dog by constantly pouncing on its tail.
meanings.sent4: The haunting memories bedeviled him, keeping him awake at night.
meanings.sent5: The persistent telemarketer bedeviled her with endless phone calls during dinner.
